creator: vanitha.venkatraman@sun.com
text:
I get the following error: "A Servlet Exception Has Occurred org.apache.jasper.compiler.ParseException: /export/vanitha/nagoya/jakarta-tomcat-4.0-b2/bin/./../webapps/tcatjsp-tests/jsp/actpos/test26XML.jsp(54,-1) Whitespace required before attributes. at org.apache.jasper.compiler.ParserXJspSax.parse(ParserXJspSax.java:195) at org.apache.jasper.compiler.ParserController.parse(ParserController.java:218)" The contents of the test26XML.jsp is as follows: ----------------------------------------------- Test26.jsp : using <jsp:include page="requestTimeAttributeValue" flush="true" />
Test Output
Passed File Name : ]]> Test26.jsp : using <jsp:include page="requestTimeAttributeValue" flush="true" /> to include contents of ]]> Contents of ]]> ]]> This stuff is after jsp:include is processed. ]]> The contents of includeme.jsp is as follows: includeme.jsp file <%@ page import="java.util.Date" %>

This is HTML content of "includeme.jsp" file

Present Date/Time : <%= new Date().toLocaleString() %>

I found the problem. The test was not in valid xml syntax. If you look at the
xml syntax doc http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml you will find that xml attribute
values are delimited with " or ' and cannot contain <, &, or the *same* type of
quotes.

In your example:

<jsp:include page="%=request.getParameter("fileName")%" flush="true" />

The nested quotes need to be escaped. You would need to do the following in
order for this to be valid xml:

<jsp:include page='%=request.getParameter("fileName")%' flush="true" />

Since you can nest one type of quote in another. Or you could escape out the
double quotes like the following:

<jsp:include page="%=request.getParameter("fileName")%" flush="true"
/>
creator: justyna.horwat@sun.com
